text: Albert Bollinger (November 22, 1870 - February 14, 1933) was an American politician, lawyer, and businessman. == Biography == Bollinger was born in Steeleville, Illinois. He was admitted to the Illinois bar in 1893 and lived in Waterloo, Illinois with his wife and family. He served in the Illinois Senate from 1897 to 1901 as a Republican. Bollinger served as the master of the Monroe County Chancery Court since 1904. He also helped organized the Waterloo First National Bank. He died from heart problems at his home in Waterloo, Illinois.'Official Directory of the Forty-First General Assembly of Illinois 1899,' J.L. Pickering, Springfield, Illinois: 1899, Biographical Sketch of Albert Bollinger, pg. 33'Ex-State Official Dead in Waterloo,' The Decatur daily Review (Illinois), February 14, 1933, pg. 1 ==Notes== ==External links== * Category:1870 births Category:1933 deaths Category:People from Randolph County, Illinois Category:People from Waterloo, Illinois Category:Businesspeople from Illinois Category:Illinois lawyers Category:Illinois Republicans Category:Illinois state senators
title: Albert Bollinger
